meanings.sent1: Before baking the cake, I always preweigh the ingredients.
meanings.sent2: The chef preweighed the flour to ensure the perfect consistency of the dough.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to preweigh its options before choosing which toy to play with.
meanings.sent4: She felt like preweighing her decisions would lead to a more balanced life.
meanings.sent5: Preweighing the pros and cons helped him make a rational choice.

meanings.definition: The act of weighing something before a specific event or process.
meanings.sent1: The preweighing of the luggage saved time at the airport check-in.
meanings.sent2: Accurate preweighing is crucial in the pharmaceutical industry.
meanings.sent3: The preweighing of the pumpkins for the contest turned into a fun competition.
meanings.sent4: Her preweighing of responsibilities made her a reliable team member.
meanings.sent5: The preweighing of the ingredients made the cooking process smoother.
